p: Maximum temperature also has an effect independently from Tmin. The risk of dengue increases as Tmax 1∶2 rises above about 20°C to a peak around 32°C after which the risk declines. The decay in the response of dengue to high levels of Tmax 1∶2 may be explained by the maximum transmission efficiency of A. aegypti achieved above 32°C [40], and by adult mosquitoes gradually dying at temperatures above 36°C [39].
